title: Araguaia Atlético Clube
text:
Araguaia Atlético Clube, also known as Araguaia, are a Brazilian <a href="association%20football">football</a> team from <a href="Alto%20Araguaia">Alto Araguaia</a>, <a href="Mato%20Grosso">Mato Grosso</a>. They competed in the <a href="Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20D">Série D</a> in 2009.
History.
Araguaia Atlético Clube were founded on December 1, 1978. They won the <a href="Campeonato%20Matogrossense%23Copa%20Governador%20do%20Mato%20Grosso">Copa Governador do Mato Grosso</a> in 2008, when they beat <a href="Uni%C3%A3o%20Esporte%20Clube">União</a> in the final. Araguaia competed in the <a href="Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20D">Série D</a> in <a href="Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20D%202009">2009</a>, when they were eliminated in the quarterfinals by <a href="Associa%C3%A7%C3%A3o%20Chapecoense%20de%20Futebol">Chapecoense</a>.
Stadium.
Araguaia play their home games at <a href="Est%C3%A1dio%20Ant%C3%B4nio%20Afonso%20de%20Melo">Bilinão</a>. The stadium has a maximum capacity of 3,000 people.
